1252554 THE INDIAN INDEPENDENCE PAKISTAN COURTS (PENDING PROCEEDINGS) ACT, 1952
ACT NO. 9 OF 1952 1 [ 23rd February, 1952.]
An Act to render ineffective certain decrees and orders passed by Courts in Pakistan against a Government in India and to provide an alternative remedy to persons who have secured such decrees or orders.
[ 23rd February, 1952.]
BE it enacted by Parliament as follows:-
1338486 1Short title. This Act may be called the Indian Independence Pakistan Courts (Pending Proceedings) Act, 1952.
437643 2 Definition. In this Act, the expression" decree to which this Act applies" means any such judgment, decree or order as is referred to in-
419062 iclause (3) of article 4 of the Indian Independence (Legal Proceedings) Order, 1947, or
1884556 iiparagraph (5) or paragraph (6) of article 13 of the High Courts (Bengal) Order, 1947, or
394494 iiiparagraph (4) or paragraph (6) 2 of article 13] of the High Courts (Punjab) Order, 1947, which has been or may hereafter be passed by a Court in Pakistan and which imposes any liability or obligation on a Government in India.
1976911 3Certain Pakistan decrees not to be given effect to in India. Notwithstanding anything contained in any of the Orders referred to in section 2, no decree to which this Act applies shall be given effect to by any Court or authority in India in so far as such decree imposes any liability or obligation on any Government in India.
974600 4Right of holder of a decree to which this Act applies to institute fresh proceedings in India.
